snippet: Douglas Trumbull, who will be receiving a special Oscar at the science and technical awards on Feb. 11, is at work on developments to make sci-fi and fantasy films bigger and brighter.
abstract: Douglas Trumbull, who will be receiving a special Oscar at the science and technical awards on Feb. 11, is at work on developments to make sci-fi and fantasy films bigger and brighter.
lead_paragraph: With the backlash to the front-running "Artist" underway -- and, right on its heels, the backlash to the backlash -- awards-watchers may not a very clear idea of what's going to happen at the Oscars on Feb. 26. But at the science and tech Oscars, on Feb. 11, we already know one winner: the special effects whiz and director Douglas Trumbull, who's being given the Gordon E. Sawyer Award for "his lifetime of technical contributions and leadership in the motion picture industry," in films like "2001: A Space Odyssey" and "Close Encounters of the Third Kind."
